Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Self-hosted Bug]: Response status code does not indicate success: 405 (Method Not Allowed)." (#8934) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

I'm unable to use this version

### Describe the bug

I'm hosting Nuget.Server in IIS. I am running NuGet.Server v3.4.1.0. 

I am running a push command: 

nuget.exe push .\CSharpClassLibDemo.1.0.0.nupkg 60f43559-b598-4bee-b13c-e75f3de3f46b -src http://myservername/Nuget

The path to the file are right. The source is right. But the thing only returns the following error. 

Pushing CSharpClassLibDemo.1.0.0.nupkg to 'http://myservername/Nuget'...
  PUT http://myservername/Nuget/
  MethodNotAllowed http://myservername/Nuget/ 150ms
Response status code does not indicate success: 405 (Method Not Allowed).

I am using the latest version of the Nuget.exe client. I've also tried with Visual Studio 2019 Package Manager console. The error is the same regardless. 


### Repro Steps

Run the above push command on a server hosted in IIS. 

### Expected Behavior

I expected a success response to my push command. 

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Additional Context and logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Update gallery jobs to use new service bus MSI" (#8930) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened pull request "Bug fixed, made it a solid outline for greater visibility" (#8933) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Fixes https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/8924

**Problem:**

On NuGet.org, when navigating a page using the keyboard (tab key), checkboxes were not completely visible, especially in high-contrast mode.

Previous version:
![Old, regular](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82980589/148620633-a09160df-098e-44c8-9694-9520182adfcb.gif)

Previous version (high-contrast mode):
![Old, high contrast](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82980589/148620774-13cd88b9-7dda-438f-a14f-bcd04a8b0058.gif)

**Fix:**

To fix this, I changed the outline to solid (and reduced the size of the outline so it wasn't too big and overbearing).

After making the changes:

New version:
![New, regular](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82980589/148620788-0599f751-d49e-4388-8e24-0a3cf28516f5.gif)

New version (high-contrast mode):
![New, high contrast](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82980589/148620798-5f98e793-4579-46ce-8317-4c1634a7eb16.gif)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Some canonical URLs are still not working" (#8932) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Just a note on this one. I think it's a configuration issue rather than code: www-1 seems to be set up with itself as a canonical host (rather than just www)

Example: https://www-1.nuget.org/profiles/WindowsSDK

_Originally posted by @MatthewSteeples in https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/8559#issuecomment-1007534574_

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[A11y] Fixes tag link color in search results" (#8931) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Fixes https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/8921

When viewing package search results on nuget.org, the links for the tags were indistinguishable from non-hyperlink text around it:
 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82980589/148151368-1b4305b8-1d28-43eb-a86f-88b94e38284b.png)

This PR fixes it and changes the tag hyperlink color such that users can differentiate between regular text and the links:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82980589/148151488-1d2f0193-3084-4cca-8613-07d51636f958.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Cloudtnine 21' world premiere " (#11494) at NuGet/Home
Opened issue "Overcome the odds" (#11493) at NuGet/Home
Closed issue "When nupkg exists on push --skip-duplicate, don't automatically push snupkg" (#9647) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
When uploading packages with `--skip-duplicate` duplicate `nupkg` packages are skipped, but symbol packages are uploaded again. 

You can take a look at this script from GitHub Actions which causes this behavior.

https://github.com/PiranhaCMS/piranha.core/blob/master/.github/workflows/publish_to_nuget.yml

Best regards

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "License URL is not loaded when connected to CodeSpace" (#10546) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Please read the following information before posting the issue. -->
<!-- If you're having trouble with the NuGet client tools (the Visual Studio extension, NuGet.exe command line tool, etc.), you are in the right place. -->
<!-- If you're having trouble with the NuGet.org Website, please post in [NuGetGallery issues](http://github.com/nuget/nugetgallery/issues) -->

## Details about Problem

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | Visual Studio | MSBuild.exe | dotnet.exe): VS

Product version: 16.9p4

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version: 

## Repro steps and/or sample project

<!-- Please add as much details as possible to help us to reproduce your problem. -->

1. Open a project in a local CodeSpace.
2. Open PMUI
3. Find a package that uses a License URL (eg, Microsoft.Internal.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.9.0 from apex public feed)
4. In the Details pane, click `View License`. Alternatively, install the package and click `View License` in the prompt.
5. Observe that the license file never loads. In Standalone, the license text is loaded.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49205731/106978899-37104580-672b-11eb-9fbe-48ec6c7ad11d.png)

Expected (Standalone):
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49205731/106979171-c3226d00-672b-11eb-92b0-515891fc18ad.png)

### Verbose Logs

<!-- Please include verbose logs (NuGet.exe <COMMAND> -verbosity detailed | dotnet.exe <COMMAND> --verbosity diag | etc...) -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "DependencyGraphRestoreUtility.RestoreAsync should take an args object to minimize public API changes." (#11491) at NuGet/Home
Opened issue "ProductVersion should be generated at compile time" (#11490) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
When we rev our product version, we currently have to do it in two places:

https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/ba01cc633f88fb2dd1bfcbcdd859fb89525a56eb/build/config.props#L13-L17

https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/ba01cc633f88fb2dd1bfcbcdd859fb89525a56eb/src/NuGet.Clients/NuGet.Tools/NuGetPackage.cs#L85

We could use the values from `config.props` to generate the `ProductVersion` constant in `NuGetPackage.cs`
